Dear Pamela Cornell-Allen:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
September 29, 2023. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-552-3662.

Sincerely,
Nabiha Rizk, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
• (3) The licensee shall document that each staff
person whose function is covered by these rules
has participated in a minimum of 50 clock hours
of planned training within the first year of
employment and a minimum of 25 clock hours of
training annually thereafter related to the
employee’s job function. At least 16 of the 50
hours provided in the first year shall be orientation
provided prior to the assumption of duties.
One of three employee’s files reviewed did not have the required number of
trainings hours.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
• (1)An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
• (j) A written evaluation of the employee’s
performance within 30 days of the
completion of the probationary period or
within 180 days, whichever is less, and a
written evaluation of the employee’s
performance annually thereafter.
One of the three employee’s files reviewed was missing the annual performance
evaluation.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
Technical assistance was provided related to Rule 4160 Emergency Restraint to ensure
staff are aware of the changes made to the rule and when a restraint is required.
Recommended reviewing training with staff during staff meetings.
3

V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
Consultation provided regarding the organizing of youths’ files so that documentation
specifically discharge forms have all the paperwork filed in one section to assist with the
audit process.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period SIR 2023C0000462, Intake date 05/16/2023,with CAP approved
06/25/2023, invovled medication logs not filled out throurghly and two medicaiton
docementation errors were found. Two of the youths’ files were missing face
sheets containing identifying data. Youths in the minor program participate in day
program with adults from the adult program. The agency has complied with the
CAP.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on a review of the facility’s budget
and the agency financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was completed and submitted for review.
The assessment documented that compliance had been achieved as a result of
the one CAP that was required during the renewal assessment in September of
2022. The assessment indicated an appropriate plan for continued monitoring of
compliance with the rules.
Staff and Youth Interviews
4

Staff reported feeling very supported by management, participating in training, and
feel that the agency is meeting the needs of the youths they serve.
The facility currently does not have youths, so no were youths interviewed.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility is a short-term shelter type residential building. The shelter is on the
second floor. It has a living room, dining room, kitchen, 2 bathrooms, and 10
bedrooms with a bed in each bedroom. The facility is clean, neat, and appropriate.
There were no issues of concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended
that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
